question: There is a new ready-mixed concrete (RMC) plant installed nearby your home and it causes various types of pollutions. Write a letter to City Council for a removal request. In your letter • describe who you are • explain what troubles you by existence of this RMC plant • tell what you want the officer to do for you
text: My name is Smith, and I reside at Green Avenue E, WestGate ON. I have been living there for the past 8 years. I am writing this letter to show my disappointment regarding the installation of a new ready-mixed concrete plant near my apartment.

Let me elaborate on the situation. When the machinery starts, it generates so much noise pollution because of the same I am unable to focus on my studies also facing a sleeping disorder problem. Moreover, it creates massive air pollution which does not let me stand on my balconies; In addition, I have to wear a mask whenever I am required to go outside. All types of these pollutants have threatened my peace of mind.

It is a clear administrative blunder of the City Council by authorizing this industrial plant in the residential vicinity. Considering the gravity of the matter, I would request you to shift this RMC with immediate effect.
I solicit your cooperation. My coordinate is (555) 456 982, and my email address is [email protected]
